edu.illinois.masalzr2.gui

Class Notices

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.illinois.masalzr2.gui.Notices
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ListListener, java.io.Serializable

    public class Notices
extends java.lang.Object
implements ListListener, java.io.Serializable
    Controller class for the bottom panel of the main game frame. Manages the notice list, the behavior when a chain of events ends, and utilizes the ListListener interface to provide Notices support to end when they need to.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      void popMe(ListEvent le)
      A pop request, only pops the first element in the list and only pops it if the AbstractNotice stored in the ListEvent is the first in the list.
      void pullMe(ListEvent le)
      Perhaps a misnomer, The ListEvent tells the Notices class that the AbstractNotice source has an update that calls for a repaint.
      void pushMe(ListEvent le)
      A push request made by a ListEvent to include a new AbstractNotice onto the chain of events

      • flushNotices

        public void flushNotices()
        Removes all notices within the list ignoring any and all chains of events

      • pushMe

        public void pushMe(ListEvent le)
        A push request made by a ListEvent to include a new AbstractNotice onto the chain of events
        Specified by:
        pushMe in interface ListListener

      • popMe

        public void popMe(ListEvent le)
        A pop request, only pops the first element in the list and only pops it if the AbstractNotice stored in the ListEvent is the first in the list. This prevents mid chain pops and events popping anything but themselves. If the chain of events is at its end, Notices will generate it's own AbstractNotice picking from one of three choices: the main menu, the in jail menu, and the game over notice.
        Specified by:
        popMe in interface ListListener

      • pullMe

        public void pullMe(ListEvent le)
        Perhaps a misnomer, The ListEvent tells the Notices class that the AbstractNotice source has an update that calls for a repaint.
        Specified by:
        pullMe in interface ListListener
